examples.text: Who was that wee lassie who was here last night?
Just a wee drop of milk for me.
I felt **a wee bit** guilty about it.
I might be a wee bit late.
Come inside for a wee dram.

definitions.definition: the period of time very early in the morning, soon after midnight

examples.text: We danced into the wee small hours of the morning.
I woke in the wee hours.

wordOrigin: adjective Middle English (originally a noun use in Scots, usually as a little wee ‘a little bit’): from Old English wēg(e) ‘balance, weight’, of Germanic origin.
